meanings.definition: A sudden loud noise or crash
meanings.sent1: The crackups of thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The crackups of the falling dishes echoed through the house.
meanings.sent3: The crackups of the fireworks startled the children at the park.
meanings.sent4: The crackups of the falling trees in the storm were deafening.
meanings.sent5: The crackups of the car collision made everyone jump.

meanings.sent1: Her constant stress led to crackups that affected her work.
meanings.sent2: The pressure caused crackups in his ability to cope with daily life.
meanings.sent3: After the breakup, he had a crackup and needed time to recover.
meanings.sent4: The crackup of emotions overwhelmed her fragile state of mind.
meanings.sent5: The crackup of anxiety made it hard for her to focus on anything else.

meanings.definition: A humorous or entertaining event or situation
meanings.sent1: The comedy show was full of hilarious crackups that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The movie had unexpected crackups that kept the audience entertained.
meanings.sent3: The family picnic turned into a crackup when the dog stole the sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: The party was a crackup with all the funny stories and jokes shared.
meanings.sent5: The comedy club always delivers crackups that leave the audience in stitches.
